speaker: JUDGE
line: If there are no further motions, the Superior Court of the State of Pennsylvania declares case number BD 237 closed.

speaker: BARTENDER
line: No way.

speaker: MULDER
line: And these unknown craft. Where were the majority sighted?

speaker: MAN WRA
line: On route home, me, others, walk onto minefield by base. Long black car drive up. No door handle. No window. No persons drive. We run. Mines...explosion, but...no sound. Nothing. Silent.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said others. Are any of them with you in America?

speaker: MAN WRA
line: Yes. Three or four of us have settled in Philadelphia.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you verify each of you worked on the base?

speaker: MAN WRA
line: Difficult to know. KGB still held much power at this time. Keep our...uh...papers."

speaker: MULDER
line: "Credentials"

speaker: MAN WRA
line: Y-yes. We are each mentioned in "Thread Three" report. You check.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you’re mentioned in "Thread Three" you must have been there on Gray October.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Hello?

speaker: JERSE
line: Hello, Mrs....Denunzio. Hi, this is Ed Jerse over at Fuller and Seigle. How are you this morning?

speaker: MRS DENUNZIO
line: Eh, the kids, you know.

speaker: JERSE
line: I understand. I just wanted to call and let you in on a stock that’s going public next week. .

speaker: MRS DENUNZIO
line: Oh, well it’s so hard after the holidays. Don’t hit her with that! I mean it! I’m sorry, what?

speaker: JERSE
line: A company in Tucson called Cryo-Cord has achieved an amazing advancement in the technology of cryogenics.

speaker: MRS DENUNZIO
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: JERSE
line: Y-you see, stem cells from the blood of an umbilical cord may be transplanted in the treatment of many life threatening diseases such as - - -

speaker: VOICE
line: Loser.

speaker: MRS DENUNZIO
line: Such as?

speaker: JERSE
line: What?

speaker: MRS DENUNZIO
line: Diseases such as what?

speaker: JERSE
line: Before that, what did you say?

speaker: MRS DENUNZIO
line: I didn’t say nothing. You were talking.

speaker: JERSE
line: Say it to my face. Right to my face. Now that I’m in front of you, call me a loser to my face.

speaker: COWORKER
line: Calm down.

speaker: VOICE
line: Trash her desk.

speaker: BOSS
line: Why don’t you go home, Ed. We’ll discuss this later.

speaker: MULDER
line: I made a last ditch effort to get out of it, but the Bureau is holding fast to its Federal Employees Vacation Policy. I haven’t taken a day off in four years, so either I take a week vacation now, or they start not paying me for eight weeks’ vacation time. I don’t like it, but I got to do it. I got to pay the rent. I got to eat Part of me can’t help thinking this is just another way to get me out of here. But it is only a week, and you’ll be here to keep an eye on things for me, so... here’s a few things for you to keep an eye on while I’m gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don’t I have a desk?

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: I always assumed that that was your area.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Back there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, so we’ll have them send down another desk and there won’t be any room to move around her but we can put them really close together face to face, maybe we can play some Battleship.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what is it you want me to keep an eye on?

speaker: MULDER
line: That contact that we met last night at the Wall who had the distinction of being present for a first - - - that being you abandoning me during questioning. In the future, I’ll make sure that all those people being interviewed provide you with a multi-media laser show to keep your interest maintained. In any case his name is Sevlov Pudovkin. He’s a Russian immigrant with a doctorate in astronautical engineering. He and several other contacts worked at a military space center in the Republic of Karelia. They smuggled out reverse-engineered reports of two alien craft which crashed and were retrieved from the Sea of Barents.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And these reports are for sale?

speaker: MULDER
line: At a high price, yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mmmhmm. Have you confirmed the identity of these individuals?

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s your assignment while I’m gone. I want you to run an INS check and a Bureau NCIC check on these individuals. All of whom now reside in the "Little Russia" section of Philadelphia. I’ve also made arrangements for travel so you can administer eye-to-eye surveillance on their activities.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m not going.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your contact, while interesting in the context of science fiction, was, at least in my memory, recounting a poorly veiled synopsis of an episode of Rocky and Bullwinkle.

speaker: MULDER
line: Eenie, meenie, chili beanie, the spirits are about to speak?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rocky and Bullwinkle are looking for an upsidasium mine. Boris Badenov alters the road signs which causes them to walk onto a secret military base, where they are picked up by a car with no windows and no door locks, and there are silent explosions from a compound called "Hushaboom."

speaker: MULDER
line: So you’re refusing an assignment based on the adventures of Moose and Squirrel?

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Refusing an assignment?" It makes it sound like you’re my superior.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do what you want. Don’t go to Philadelphia, But let me remind you that I worked my ass off to get the files reopened. You were just assigned. This work is my life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And it’s become mine.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don’t want it to be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This isn’t about you. Or maybe it is, indirectly. I don’t know. I feel like I’ve lost sight of myself, Mulder. It’s hard to see, let alone find in the darkness of covert locations. I mean, I wish I could say that we were going in circles, but we’re not. We’re going in an endless line - - two steps forwards and three steps back. While my own life is...standing still.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe it’s good that we get away from each other for a while.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where will you be?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ironically enough, it’s personal. It’s a... place I always wanted to go. What I anticipate to be a spiritual journey. I hope to... discover something about myself. Maybe you should do the same.

speaker: JERSE
line: Yes, Mrs. Shima-Tsuno. Ma’am, what if I swore to you that it would never happen again?... I just would like another chance..... I-I need another chance, Mrs. Shima-Tsuno.... Look, that stock I recommended, virtual gambling, is up.... Mm-hmm.... Mm-hmm.... Right... I understand.... Thank you for your time.... Good bye.

speaker: VOICE
line: "Thank you for your time." If you were any kind of man, you would have told her to kiss your ass, but no. Another woman sticks it to you. Ain’t that right... Eddie.

speaker: JERSE
line: Hey! I can hear you down there. Hey! Stop it! Shut up! Shut up down there! Knock it off!

speaker: KEITH PARTRIDGE
line: I go downtown, and roam all around but every street I walk, I find another dead end. I’m on my own, but I’m so all alone I need somebody so I won’t have to pretend....

speaker: VOICE
line: You hear that? It’s you, Ed. It’s all about you

speaker: JEHOVAH WOMAN
line: Good evening, my name is Hannah, and this is Spencer. Have you ever imagined what it would be like - - -

speaker: JERSE
line: Do-do you hear that? D-downstairs.

speaker: HANNAH
line: What I hear is the confusing and troubling sound of- - -

speaker: JERSE
line: She’s trying to drive me crazy.

speaker: HANNAH
line: Oh, we just talked to Miss Schilling, and I don’t believe she would do - -

speaker: JERSE
line: Somehow, she knows what I thinking. I don’t want to feel it --- but they know, like psychics or something, or an implant thing, trying to drive me crazy. They’ve even programmed the TV to criticize me. There, you hear it? There! There! There!

speaker: HANNAH
line: W-we’ll come back some other time.

speaker: VOICE
line: Mm-mm-mm. You see? Even the Jehovah Witness babe won’t waste her time on you. No woman would, and you just sit and take it. Take it like a man.

speaker: MS SCHILLING
line: Hey, what are you doing? Get out of here. What do you think you’re doing? Get out of my apartment!

speaker: VOICE
line: Attaboy, lover. From now on, I’m your right-hand gal. You and me. As long as I’m with you, no one will ever hurt you, Never Again. commercial

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, hey. Scully, it’s me. I-I’m just calling to see how you’re doing, and uh... Give me a call... Give me a call on my cel when you get a chance, just let me know where you’re at....

speaker: JERSE
line: No, that’s not my problem. You did good work. It’s very nice. It’s just like in the window, but...

speaker: SVO
line: So what? Why do you want to cover it? Listen friend, everyone gets tattoo they deserve.

speaker: JERSE
line: What if you don’t cover the whole thing? Just the eyes and the mouth?

speaker: SVO
line: Even if I say yes, it’s too soon. The skin must heal.

speaker: JERSE
line: I’ll pay you anything.

speaker: SVO
line: Miss, miss. You. You like this on his arm?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wow.

speaker: VOICE
line: Eddie?.....

speaker: SCULLY
line: The, uh, the color... the red on the lips. It’s extraordinary.

speaker: SVO
line: Something I find in Soviet prison. I tell him, everyone gets tattoo they deserve. Beautiful, Cheap. Thought over. Impulse.

speaker: VOICE
line: Thought I was your girl.

speaker: SVO
line: Tattoo reflect on body what lies in person’s soul......

speaker: VOICE
line: You’d break my heart over a cheap redhead?

speaker: SVO
line: ...use the sewing needle, paperclip.....

speaker: VOICE
line: You talk to her, and I’m going to be bad.

speaker: SVO
line: ...charcoal shavings, urine. I find grasses growing in prison yard. Rye and such. Only use now, on that tattoo.

speaker: PUDOVKIN
line: Svo.

speaker: SVO
line: Pardon me. You look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm. Thank you.

speaker: JERSE
line: Mind some advice from a stranger? Make sure you’ve thought it over before you get it done.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What, you didn’t get the tattoo you deserve?

speaker: JERSE
line: Mine was too impulsive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Never say never. Yeah, sometimes I wish I were that impulsive.

speaker: JERSE
line: Careful what you wish for. There’s more fashionable places in the city. How did you end up here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m in town visiting my aunt in the neighborhood. How bout you.

speaker: JERSE
line: There’s a real crummy bar across the street. It’s good for when you’re feeling down. I was kind of down last week and uh...

speaker: SCULLY
line: So it wasn’t so much "impulsive" as it was "hammered?"

speaker: JERSE
line: Have you... um... seen much of Philadelphia?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: JERSE
line: There’s a couple of really nice restaurants by the river, if you’re interested.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’d like that. But um.... I’m... um leaving tonight.

speaker: JERSE
line: Uh, if you’re ever in town again, that’s my home number. I work there mainly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. What’s wrong? He is in MEMPHIS, TENNESSEE

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing’s wrong. I’m just at that special place, and I wanted to share it with you. Did you know that Elvis bought all the furniture in just 30 minutes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you know where I was?

speaker: MULDER
line: I-I checked where we always stay in Philadelphia. I knew you wouldn’t abandon me. How’s the case going?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’ve handed it over to the Philadelphia bureau.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Philadelphia bureau? They don’t know or care about the X-files. What are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there is no Xfile. Your contact is connected to the Vorofskoi Mir, extortion, credit fraud, cons, he is nothing but a swindler.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean, how do I know? You assigned me the background check. I did as told, as always.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, just hold off until I get there, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What, you don’t think I’m capable?

speaker: MULDER
line: Of course I believe that you’re capable, it’s just that in this case I need you to...

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s not just in this case, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wh-what’s the agent’s name in Philadelphia?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It is over. Done. Pudovkin is out of our hands. Look Mulder, I have to go.

speaker: MULDER
line: What, have you got a date, or something? Y-you’re kidding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have everything under control. I will talk to you later.

speaker: VOICE
line: Isn’t it better this way, baby? Me and you alone. Women are so petty.... jealous.... controlling. That bitch today would have been just like all the others.

speaker: JERSE
line: Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, hi. Um, Ed Jerse, please.

speaker: JERSE
line: This is him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s Dana. We met today. Um, my, uh, my flight was cancelled because of the storm and I was just wondering if I could take you up on dinner.

speaker: JERSE
line: I think it’s worth fighting a little snow. One thing - - my car is in the shop. We’ll have to meet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I could pick you up.

speaker: JERSE
line: Give me an hour?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good. Well uh, I’ll see you then.

speaker: VOICE
line: Go ahead. Treat yourself. This girl is a real doll. But beauty is only skin deep, baby. I go all the way to the bone. commercial

speaker: SPENCER
line: She said she’d be here. Ms. Schilling?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: JERSE
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m, uh, early. The storm’s not so bad.

speaker: JERSE
line: It’s supposed to get bad later tonight. Come on in. I’ll be ready in a second. At least we can forego "what-a-nice-place-you-have" formalities.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed, I-I uh, I don’t go out very much. I think the last time I went on a date was to see Glen Garry Glen Ross and the characters in the movie had a much better time. Ed, you’re bleeding.

speaker: JERSE
line: It’s just the damn tattoo. Um, here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m a doctor. Do you want me to take a look at it?

speaker: JERSE
line: No, it’s okay. It’s been nothing but trouble.

speaker: JERSE
line: I hope you like this place. I made reservations.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed.... the, uh... the crummy bar you told me about. Take me there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what make this place a good place to go when you’re feeling down?

speaker: JERSE
line: Oh, it’s kind of... Everyone here looks like their problems are worse than mine. Makes me feel good about myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but you can’t tell what’s going on in somebody’s head just by looking at them. I mean, they’re probably thinking that we’re the ones that are screwed up.

speaker: JERSE
line: Are we?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who knows? I mean sometimes, I, uh... I’ve always gone around in this, uh... this circle. It usually starts when an authoritative or controlling figure comes into my life. And part of me likes it, needs it, wants the approval. But then at a certain point, along the way, I just, you know.... Okay, umm.... My father was a Navy Captain. I worshipped - - I worship - - the sea that he sailed on. And when I was 13 or so I went through this.... thing , where I would sneak out of my parents house and smoke my mother’s cigarettes. And I did it because I knew that if he found out, he would kill me. And then... along the way, there are other... fathers.

speaker: JERSE
line: Sounds a little like you time has come around again. I want things more like a straight line, and I don’t ever want to go backward. That’s why I got the tattoo I deserve. Marked the moment, the feeling... memorial of something that I never want to have happen again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want to see it.

speaker: JERSE
line: You know, Dana, just ‘cause I marked the moment wanting to go forward doesn’t mean that it worked.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want to see it.

speaker: JERSE
line: Come on. It’s all scabbed up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s okay.

speaker: JERSE
line: You’re so curious. Get your own.

speaker: JERSE
line: She wants the same red. Like mine.

speaker: JERSE
line: Look, the weather and a few drinks under your belt... I’d feel better if you stayed here. Hey, I’m not up to anything. I just want you to be safe. I’ll take the couch. That tattoo hurt at all?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, um.... it feels weird. I, uh, I can’t see it and..... but I feel different. It’s like, um, I don’t know how I feel about that.

speaker: JERSE
line: It looks all right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed, you’re bleeding again. Will you let me take a look at it? I am a doctor.

speaker: JERSE
line: They said this could happen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed, it looks burned.

speaker: VOICE
line: Get her hands off of me!

speaker: VOICE
line: Those are bad thoughts you’re having, baby. Kiss her and she’s dead. Commercial

speaker: HOTEL
line: Adam’s Inn.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dana Scully, please.

speaker: HOTEL
line: I’m sorry, sir, there is no answer in that room.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MAN #1
line: Good morning. I’m Detective Gouveia and this is Detective Smith. May we speak with Edward Jerse?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, I’m sorry. He’s not in. I don’t know where he is.

speaker: GOUVEIA
line: Were you here the night before last?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Could I help you with something? I’m with the Bureau.

speaker: SMITH
line: The resident downstairs, Kaye Schilling, was reported missing. Some blood was found in her apartment - - not hers. It had some, uh... abnormalities.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Such as? Look, I have a background in forensic medicine. I assure you that anything you divulge to me will be held in the strictest confidence.

speaker: GOUVEIA
line: Well, a preliminary toxicology report found this substance in the bloodstains. Blood type was "A", and hers was "O."

speaker: SCULLY
line: May I?

speaker: SMITH
line: Look. Here’s our card. We’d appreciate Mr. Jerse giving us a call when he returns. And if he doesn’t, we will.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Federal Bureau of Investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, Fox Mulder, please.

speaker: WOMAN
line: One moment.

speaker: JERSE
line: Good morning. What’s wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ed. Sit down. Some detectives were here. The woman in the apartment downstairs was reported missing. They found some blood in her apartment and I believe circumstantially, it may be yours.

speaker: JERSE
line: I was helping her move in and I cut myself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You need to tell that to the detectives. But what I’m also afraid of - - and this concerns both of us - - is that an ergot alkaloid was found in the blood which is why I think it may have been yours. Now ergot is a parasite that lives off of rye and related grasses. Svo said that he used rye somehow in his ink. Now if this is true, we may be subject to hallucinogenic ergotism. Aural, visual hallucinations. Dangerous and unlikely behavior. We need to go to the hospital to be tested.

speaker: JERSE
line: I don’t need that, Dana. It’s such a relief to be able to tell someone. I hear it, Dana. In my head, only deeper. It’s more than just some chemical reaction. She talks to me. She hates women...my wife, my boss... you. She’s so jealous, Dana. She makes me do things. I don’t want to, but she controls me. But I believe that you made her go away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need to get help. Now, I’m going to go into the other room and I’m going to come back and we are going to go together.

speaker: VOICE
line: Mmm-hmmm. Who’d she call? Who’d she call, Eddie? Come on. Aren’t you just dying to know?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Federal Bureau of Investigation.

speaker: VOICE
line: Dana Scully, please.

speaker: JERSE
line: Dana Scully, please.

speaker: WOMAN
line: One moment please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, let’s go.

speaker: JERSE
line: Never again!! Never again!

speaker: VOICE
line: Another woman in my bed? Burn the sheets! Burn her. Burn her!

speaker: VOICE
line: Come on. Do it for me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This isn’t you, Ed.

speaker: VOICE
line: Go on, Eddie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get control of yourself.

speaker: VOICE
line: Ah, but it’s good to lose control.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Take control!

speaker: VOICE
line: Do it!

speaker: MULDER
line: Welcome back. You look a lot better than you did in the hospital. And congratulations for making an personal appearance in the Xfiles for the second time. It’s a world’s record. Ed Jerse is in custody at the St. John’s burn facility in Philadelphia. Traces of ergot were found in his bloodstream as in yours, but not to the degree that should cause hallucinogenic ergotism. He’ll undergo psychiatric evaluation after recovering from burn trauma. Comrade Svo has been shut down, he was under investigation for having connections to my friend Pudovkin. Case closed on Boris Badenov, which is really a shame because I was thinking of having an "N.Y." tattooed on my ass to commemorate the Yankees’ World Series victory. Better late than never, hunh.

speaker: MULDER
line: The uh, field office in Dallas is uh, receiving reports of the image of a missing child appearing on a blank billboard outside of Arlington.......so.... All this, because I’ve... because I didn’t get you a desk?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not everything is about you, Mulder. This is my life.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes but it’s m - -
